etymologies: mid 16th century: from hire+ -ling, on the pattern of Dutch huurling

definitions: a person employed to do menial work

examples.text: the poorly paid hirelings in their shabby clothes

shortDefinitions: person employed to do menial work

definitions: a person who works purely for material reward

examples.text: the management and board of directors are just hirelings of the stock owners

shortDefinitions: person who works purely for material reward
